bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to Howard A. Kelly, July 6, 1906

div1.p: Carroll will provide Kelly with letters for his biography of Reed. Carroll anticipates writing a defense of himself only if necessary.

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to Howard A. Kelly, July 6, 1906

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
July 6, 1906.

div1.p:
I received
your kind letter of the 3d
yesterday and I have gather-
ed together some letters to-
day which I shall bring over
with me tomorrow. Some of the
letters are short but very
precious to me; you might have
copies of these made while I
wait. The others I can leave
with you for perusal at your
leisure, with the request that
you will kindly return them
to me later. I have con-
templated taking up the
subject my self in the near
future and it may be
necessary in the interests
of my family to do so. How-
ever writing is not my forte
and it is not becoming for a
man to write of himself personally
nor do I relish the task
unless it becomes a duty.

Will you kindly leave
word at your office address
so that I may learn by
'phone the hour at which
it will be most convenient
for you to see me? I shall
be in Baltimore the whole
afternoon and will call
up your office soon after
my arrival in the city.

Thanking you for your generous
proposition with which I heartily
agree I remain
div1.closer:
Gratefully & sincerely yours; James Carroll
names? Watts

Dorsey Elsie Gladys
